shared_text:
Rich Young, School Committee Member
June 4 at 1:47 PM ·

Signing Day-

You don’t get many perks being the Chairman of the School Committee but the best one is that my name is on each one of the diplomas representing all the School Committee members.

Brian Lynch, Paul Branagan and I made a pact to make sure we would sign each one. No signatures stamps from us! The three of us thought it was the least we could do for these young men and women, who worked so hard to get to this point.

As I signed each one, I got to think of many of these people that I have met or who in some way, shape or form have helped me to grow. Although this Graduation is not the one we all dreamed for these seniors, I appreciate who they are and how they came to get to this point. I am honored to do my small part to recognize each one of you!

Congratulations Class of 2020!

Four members of the Middleborough Sachem football team Kyle Maloney, Andy Brown, Jake Segreve, Tim Crowley, Coach Pat Kingman and MHS teacher Bill Breen paid a visit to Mr. Walter Campbell, at the Nemasket Nursing Home. The team signed a football helmet and the four players presented it to him.

Mr. Campbell (MHS Class of 1947) played for Coach Battis from 1944-46 and was one of the first players to play on Battis Field.

Tomorrow, MHS will play its final scheduled game on Battis Field after 79 years. Walter served in the US Navy for 26 years.

Kickoff is scheduled for 10am with Senior recognition starting at 9:30.

We hope to see a huge crowd!

Attention Parents-->Tonight @ 6:30pm in the Henry B. Burkland School Auditorium:
All Middleborough Public School Families are invited to attend this workshop led by Cindy Goldrich of PTS Coaching. "SKILLS FOR SUCCESS: WHAT EVERY PARENT/GUARDIAN NEEDS TO KNOW ABOUT LEARNING AND MINDSET".
Executive Functions are the cognitive skills needed for academic performance, social skills, and life skills. Commonly, these are the skills utilized to organize, plan, initiate, manage emotion, shift /maintain focus and use working memory. They govern the HOW you do what you DECIDE to do. This presentation will briefly explain how Executive Function skills are developed and will include tips, tools, and strategies parents can use to promote optimal success in all aspects of life. *Followed by a Question and Answer session with Cindy Goldrich
